intro: Ardisia agasthyamalayana, commonly known as the Western Ghats ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats in India. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, dark red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often in mountainous regions. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
